text: John Mackie (died 3 July 1858) was a British Whig politician. He was elected Whig MP for Kirkcudbrightshire at a by-election in 1850—caused by Thomas Maitland's appointment as a senator of the College of Justice—and held the seat until the 1857 general election, when he stepped down in favour of his son James Mackie. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Whig (British political party) MPs for Scottish constituencies Category:UK MPs 1847–1852 Category:UK MPs 1852–1857 Category:1858 deaths
title: John Mackie (Kirkcudbright MP)
